title: Replace AST dump with call to `TokenCollector`

milestone.title: Procedural Macros 2
milestone.description: Finish up and polish the work started for [`Procedural Macros 1`](https://github.com/Rust-GCC/gccrs/milestone/16). Once this milestone is complete, `gccrs` should have a fully fledged procedural macro expansion system with support for complexe derive macros and such.

body:
- The ast dump lacks several informations (missing keyword, missing field, missing attributes...)
- The `TokenCollector` shall transcribe back to a **perfect** Vector of token from the AST since it is used by procedural macros.
- Maintaining the token collector up to date is mandatory for procedural macros.

This means the token collector coupled with a call to `as_string` on resulting tokens would give us the exact rust text from the ast at a reduced cost (we would no longer have to maintain the ast dump code).

## Problem
The token collector lacks proper indentation (no indentation token exists) but some functions are already waiting for this formatting code (eg. `newline()`, `increment_indentation()`, `decrement_indentation()` and `indentation()`)

## Possible solution
These functions can be used by changing the TokenCollector internal buffer to accept some kind of c++11 `std::variant` containing either a token or a formatting character (`\n`, `\t`, ...).

- [ ] change the internal buffer of the token collector.
- [ ] ignore formatting char variants for procedural macro token collection.
- [ ] change ast dump call to `TokenCollector` visitor followed by calls to `as_string` on resulting tokens.
- [ ] Remove `dump_tokenstream` (`-frust-ast-tokenstream`) from the session manager.
